Class RelationalDatabases

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Facade providing JDBC based operations.

        public static java.lang.Object executeInsert​(java.sql.Connection jdbcConnection,

                                             java.lang.Object... arguments)
                                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                             java.sql.SQLException
        Executes any kind of SQL insert statement, optionally returning an auto-generated key.
        Parameters:
        jdbcConnection - the JDBC connection
        sql - the SQL statement
        arguments - the statement arguments, optionally including null values
        Returns:
        the auto-generated key, or null for none
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given JDBC connection or SQL statement is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the insert statement created more or less than one row, or if more than one column was auto-generated
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an SQL related problem
